channel.title: Random Item Sets
channel.description:
public int randomDragon() { int[] items = {[b]1149[/b], [b]3140[/b], [b]1187[/b], [b]4585[/b], [b]4087[/b]}; if ((double)Math.random()*100 <= [b]25[/b]) { return Math.floor((double)Math.random()*items.length()); } return -1; }
The 25 is the percentage that you will recieve a random item from the item[] array. You can change the percentage to whatever you want. All of the numbers inside of the item[] array can be replaced by you, for what you choose. My example is a 25% chance of recieving a random peice of dragon armour, that being: dragon med, dragon chain, dragon sq, dragon skirt, dragon legs. It would be used like this: [code] addItem(randomDragon(), 1); [/code] Or for whatever method you choose.

item.title: Random Item Sets
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

[quote=“Delta_, post:4, topic:226104”]Why not do this?

if (misc.random(100) == 25) { randomDragon(); } [/quote]
Because that’s wrong as fuck?

Read full topic

item.title: Random Item Sets
item.dc:creator: @Delta2 Delta_
item.description:
@Delta2 wrote:

Why not do this?

if (misc.random(100) == 25)
{
randomDragon();
}

Read full topic

item.title: Random Item Sets
item.dc:creator: @eXtrosion eXtrosion
item.description:
@eXtrosion wrote:

Thats really good idea! that might be just the thing im looking for… I might have loads and loads of random items in it thanks for this

-waves, eXtrosion

Read full topic

item.title: Random Item Sets
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

public int randomDragon() { int[] items = {[b]1149[/b], [b]3140[/b], [b]1187[/b], [b]4585[/b], [b]4087[/b]}; if ((double)Math.random()*100 <= [b]25[/b]) { return Math.floor((double)Math.random()*items.length()); } return -1; }
The 25 is the percentage that you will recieve a random item from the item[] array. You can change the percentage to whatever you want. All of the numbers inside of the item[] array can be replaced by you, for what you choose.

My example is a 25% chance of recieving a random peice of dragon armour, that being: dragon med, dragon chain, dragon sq, dragon skirt, dragon legs.

It would be used like this:

addItem(randomDragon(), 1);

Or for whatever method you choose.

Read full topic
